qas.question: Where is Washington University's north campus located?

answers.text: St. Louis City near the Delmar Loop

qas.question: When was the building and property for the north campus of Washington University acquired?
What previously occupied the building used at the north campus of Washington University?
For what department does the north campus location of Washington University provide off-site storage?
Who is Washington University's food provider on campus?
On what campuses are the student focused administrative functions located?
What does the West Campus lie near?
In what year did the school acquire the West Campus building?
In what year did Bob Appetit Management Company become the on-campus food provider?
What is something based in the West Campus?

context: Washington University's <b5_0>North Campus<b5_0/> and West Campus principally house administrative functions that are not student focused. North Campus lies in <a0_0>St. Louis City near the <b6_0>Delmar Loop<b6_0/><a0_0/>. The University acquired the building and adjacent property in <a1_0><b7_0><b8_0>2004<b8_0/><b7_0/><a1_0/>, formerly home to the <a2_0>Angelica Uniform Factory<a2_0/>. Several University administrative departments are located at the North Campus location, including offices for Quadrangle Housing, Accounting and Treasury Services, Parking and Transportation Services, Army ROTC, and Network Technology Services. The North Campus location also provides off-site storage space for the <a3_0>Performing Arts Department<a3_0/>. Renovations are still ongoing; recent additions to the North Campus space include a small eatery operated by <a4_0>Bon Appétit Management Company<a4_0/>, the University's on-campus food provider, completed during spring semester 2007, as well as the <b9_0>Family Learning Center<b9_0/>, operated by Bright Horizons and opened in September 2010.
